The mascara wand is small and is able to get every lash. I was told the mascara makes my lashes look very natural-  of clumpy. The mascara really lengthened my lashes.

title: Better than flossing or brushing alone!
text:
This is a good water flosser . I'm comparing it to others I have owned. The last one I had did not last long- this appears to be better made and it just looks nicer overall. The water well holds a fair amount of water however I would like it to hold a bit more. It has many levels of power for the water to spray out. The low is very weak and the high is pretty darn strong and could be painful if you aren't careful. There are plenty of adjustments in between so you will find one that suits your mouth just right. It also has a “massage “ button which basically cuts down the strength of the jet and makes it pulse to massage your gums. I find it a bit too soft of my gums , even on the highest level. This product does a great job in cleaning between your teeth and below gum line. I hate to floss so this is a great option to keep my teeth clean and well cared for. If your house is Not new and only has one plug in your bathroom, you will appreciate the long cords- both the electrical and the water hose. One thing I like about this water flosser is that it does NOT leak like my other one did. This keeps my counter neat. This is a good product to add to your daily dental hygiene regimen . It is easy and does a great job cleaning .

title: This was a steal at this price!!
text:
Eeeeeeekkk I'm so excited about this!! I love my Dry Bar Buttercup hair dryer, but really wanted a diffuser for it because I like to scrunch my hair time to time. When I added it to my cart, it was $21 I believe. That's still cheaper than Sephora so I was going to get it but waited. SO GLAD I DID. Randomly, it dropped to $12.12!!!! Purchased immediately!!

It fits my hair dryer perfectly. But, I can tell by looking at it that my hair dryer isn't a standard size on the end so I had to purchase the Bio Ionic brand since that's who makes my hair dryer. Worth it! It says universal, but I would still take measurements to make sure it'll fit yours if it isn't a Bio Ionic brand because they are not ever all universal.

The part that attaches to your hair dryer is not a hard plastic- it is rubbery (but firm) so it slides onto your hair dryer but doesn't "click" into place. I think that's why they say it's universal because this allows for some difference in the size of your dryer. But still do your research and compare your hair dryer to the size of the Buttercup hair dryer because it fits it perfectly.

You can also twist the diffuser to open up the vents or close them to control the air flow (see pictures). There will always be air flow on the outer ring of the diffuser, but you can completely close off the center, which is nice if you don't want a ton of force.

I love it and it was completely worth it!

title: This is a great spatula and plate deal
text:
This is a great spatula and plate deal. It's small enough to not need much space but big enough for what I needed it for. I was in the process of de-potting my lipsticks, and I used this to place them on while I worked, to keep things sanitary. Cleans up perfectly with alcohol. Mine came in perfect condition, not at all scratched like you can read in some reviews for these. I use this day to day when I need to lay out some foundation for application or to put some powder on before applying to my face. It keeps all of my bottles from being contaminated when applying product. It's been a wonderful addition to my kit!

Edited to add: I noticed that there are many reviews on here that are coming from people that have gotten this discounted/free in exchange for a review. I am NOT one of those people. I purchased this on my own, with my own money, because I needed a spatula and plate to use for cosmetics. So, please trust that my review is honest and give it a "YES" for helpfulness! Thanks so much!

title: Great straightening brush.
text:
I never brush my hair, because, when I do, it just becomes a very frizzy mess. I was worried this brush was going to provide the same results. I'm happy to say, I was wrong, and pleasantly surprised by how well it actually worked! This set comes with two strong clips for helping you separate your hair and a cleaning brush.

You'll need to start with clean, dry, and tangle-free ( as much as possible) hair for best results. If you want to change the temperature setting from Celsius to Fahrenheit just press down on both temperature buttons at the same time. Also, They have temperature recommendations based on hair types; 410°F-446°F (210°C~230°C) for fine hair.
374°F-410°F (190°C~210°C) for normal hair.
338°F-392°F (170°C~200°C) for soft hair.

What I really like about this brush:
1. It gives my hair a more natural-looking straight hair versus my flat iron.
2. It's very easy to use.
3. The bristles are very long which keeps the heating element away from your fragile scalp. I never felt my head get hot while using it.
4. I could safely and easily use this brush on my oldest daughter to tame her hair craziness. I wouldn't say that about my flat iron.
5. This brush would work for most hair types. My underneath layers of my hair are very thick, coarse, and extremely curly while the top layer is thinner, and just wavy.

My dislikes:
1. The control buttons are placed very inconveniently on the brush handle making it very difficult to not accidentally change setting while in use.
2. The bristles are long. This makes it safe to use, but difficult to tame those little flyaways that are very close to your head.
3. This isn't a problem for my hair, but from my use of this product I don't think it would work well for those that have spiral curls.
4. The back side of the brush also gets extremely hot; be careful!

Overall, I really like this brush and feel it is well worth it's price! I will still keep and use my flat iron for special events, but i know I will use this brush for everyday styling.
I received this product in exchange for honest feedback. The opinions expressed in the review are solely mine.

title: Paraben free, silicone free, sulfate free but not EWG verified
text:
I searched the EWG website for this company and product and in many spelling varieties and came up empty handed. If this product was indeed EWG verified, it would not only be on the website but it would have the EWG logo on the product plus it wouldn't have linalool which is high on the allergy list.

Other than the linalool, this has decent ingredients. It is silicone free, paraben free, sulfate free and alcohol free. I would stay away from this product if you have malassezia (fungal) acne as olive and japonica may be triggers and/or pore clogging.

Like all natural bar shampoos, it won't lather like traditional synthetic shampoos but it does clean. It takes some getting use too and a period of detoxing for your hair to get use to the change in chemicals if you are switching from synthetic to natural but it is worth it!

I would recommend this shampoo bar however I am rather concerned about the EWG verified claim.

title: 🚫Contains synthetic perfumes and colors 🚫
text:
The list of ingredients isn't in English which is a big thing for me as I am sensitive to certain products. The ones that are in English, Solanum Melongena which is an eggplant extract, EDTA which is a chelating agent and not good for you at all, Camellia Sinensis Leaf which is a skin conditioner and perfume and CI 77492 which is a synthetic cosmetic colorant. There is a -20 which typically is a PEG which Polyethylene Glycol and can cause health issues if used in excess.

The application of the product itself is a neat concept and makes applying a mask much easier. There are unnecessary perfumes and colors in this product along with EDTA and possibly PEG which I stay away from.

Learn your skin and what it can handle also what you are looking for in a skin. This is not a natural product by any stretch of the imagination.

title: Pretty decent product but do your research
text:
Overall, this product isn't horrible compared to others on the market. It is paraben-free, sulfate-free, EU Allergen free and uses minimal ingredients however it also contains alcohol, silicone and is not safe for fungal acne. After running this product through a cosmetic ingredient safety checker, it scored an 88% one the EWG Health Rating. Most popular, name-brand face lotions are around 65%-80% on the EWG Health Rating. I use the EWG (Environment Working Group) as a reference when checking products and try to stay away from the alarmist side. Only 8% of this product is considered “moderate risk” mainly polyarylamide, Fragrance (unnecessary additive; possible allergy) , alcohol denat. (Bad for dry skin, bad for sensitive skin, potentially block pores) and BHT (also found in edibles, rubber products and is banned in UK and EU due to limited research showing BHT is linked to cancer). This product is good for brightening, anti-aging and promotes wound healing. It also contains steric acid which can potentially block pores.

Keep in mind, everyone's skin is different and what effects one person may not effect another. Learn your skin and what products work best for you. Personally, I would stay away from this product if you have very dry skin and/or sensitive skin. I have “normal” skin (no sensitivities, not overly dry or oily, limited acne, no allergies) and didn't have any issues with this product so far. It has a light scent that isn't overpowering but completely unnecessary (I HATE fragrance in beauty products; stick with essential oils). It absorbed nicely and didn't leave my face feeling oily. I am giving this product 4 stars as of February 21, 2021 due to the minimal ingredients and will update this review once a larger amount of time has passed to fully understand how to works with my skin.

title: Smells Great and Helps Tame Big hair
text: I received my new Argan Oil shampoo and was super excited to start using it. I have thick natural, healthy, unprocessed shoulder length hair. What I noticed with this shampoo was first of all it took a lot of shampoo the first time I washed it (one of two times) to get my hair to lather. Since this is organic I was not surprise to find this, but disappointed that it seemed to take so much shampoo. My fix the second time I washed my hair was to use a different shampoo for the "starter wash" and to use the Argan oil for the final wash. I LOVE how the shampoo smells and how it looks when I've finished blow drying and styling my hair. My hair is quite thick and can get kind of frizzy and have fly aways which did not happen with this shampoo. Typically I cannot wash my hair everyday, as it usually takes a couple days for my hair to "fall" and not look so "big". Fortunately, my hair looked great immediately with this new shampoo. I also washed my hair before a house party for New Years and had MANY compliments from various family members over the wonderful smell of my shampoo. Several requests were made by my mom, sister, sister in law and niece to tell them the name of my shampoo. It has a fresh spa like scent and appears to be a cross between a bit of honey and vanilla in the fragrance. I LOVE this shampoo and was very excited to have the opportunity to review this product for my unbiased opinion.

title: May work for you depending on eye shape
text: Magnetic eyelashes are an interesting concept for those times you want a dramatic look but don't want the hassle of glue on lashes.  The magnetic liner works well but it must be applied pretty thick in order to give enough area for the lashes to stick.  You have to be careful when placing them also as  you cannot really adjust the position because pulling the lashes off usually tears the liner off with it, so you have to then clean the lashes and reapply liner if you make a mistake which is kind of a hassle.  The two lashes included here are nice but neither one really worked for my eye shape, I got another kit which had 7 different shapes in it and that one had two styles that work well for me so I would probably recommend getting one with more options to ensure you find one that fits your eye shape.

title: Highly recommended
text: I ordered several different body oils when I first discovered I was pregnant. The directions state to start using during your second trimester, but I started using this product immediately. Over the course of two months of daily use my existing scars started to fade and turn from silver to a much more natural tan color to match my olive skin. (These are very serious scars from being attacked by a box cutter about 8 years ago.) Bio Oil is evening out less substantial scars that weren't faded by Maderma. I'm now into my second trimester and my body is starting to grow. My old scars are continuing to fade substantially and I haven't developed a single stretch mark. I will write a follow up review regarding stretch marks in another three months when my pregnancy body is a bit more.... Yeah

title: Impressive!
text:
I have thick loose wavy hair and I had damanged hair from the years of hair straighting and hard water. No conditioner or leave in treatments have been able to help restore my hair. It was at the point where I couldn't even run my fingers through it without kinks. My hair felt like straw and always looked dry and frizzy no matter what I did to it. After using this, my hair feels amazing. Smooth and has a nice slip to it. No more kinks. I think the best part is that this doesn't wash off. I'm not sure how many showers I have to go through before I have to reapply, but I can tell one tube will last me for a while. After you shower, grab enough of this to cover a thin layer in your hair and then blow dry. It will feel sticky and tacky but once your hair is completely dried, it will just feel like smooth silky hair. If you feel you put too much in one area, put some water in that area to thin the cream and then blow dry again.

I really wish I found out about this product before I chopped off my hair. But seriously, wow! Amazing product. Instant and permanent! KBeauty has done it again.

title: I'm a dude and these are pretty good
text:
I don't know anything about the other reviews that talk about the original Salux from Japan versus impostors from China. I've never owned a product like this before. I am male and have sensitive skin that's prone to irritation that results in random pores getting clogged on my arms or chest or legs. I bought these on a recommendation to test out and see if they helped. I've only had them for a few days, and can't really say yet if they've done anything for my pores or not, but they do seem to be doing a really good job at exfoliating my skin.

The individual towels are roughly 12 inches wide by 24 or 30 inches long. They're made of some sort of woven nylon or plastic material that is kind of wavy and extremely abrasive when rubbed across the skin. You use the towel by putting a dollop of liquid soap onto it and then rubbing it onto your body to create a lather. The towel is long enough that you can easily scrub your back by holding the ends of the towel and pulling back and forth. The towels are abrasive enough that it really feels like you're scraping a layer of skin off. Probably not appropriate for use anywhere sensitive.

I'm loving these so far. Highly recommended.

title: good budget value tooth care kit for single people, but absolutely no fancy features or extras
text:
For the price, this is an excellent basic electric toothbrush and flosser. The two pieces lack the fancy features of more expensive pieces, but my dentist says all those extra features are not worth the money. The toothbrush works great and the only feature my dentist recommends is the 2 minute timer to make sure you give yourself enough time to brush all your teeth. I've always used string floss in the past, but this water flosser seems to work just as well most of the time. Sometimes there is some food stuck in my teeth that I still have to use the string for.

As I said, features are minimal. There is 1 charger for both devices, so you can't use the charger as a stand for both items. Instead of all the cardboard in the box, why not include a cheap plastic tray or stand? There also is no travel case, just a little cover for the toothbrush head. I would really prefer a full length hard case to be included instead of having to buy an aftermarket case that doesn't fit well. Also, you only get one tip each for both the flosser and the toothbrush and there is nowhere to easily store extras. This kit is probably designed for single people only, not couples or families.

title: Even if we don't eat 2 pounds a lifetime!
text:
I paid $24.99 for the 4 cavity 3 way lipstick mold and a few days later it jumped to $59, possibly different sellers I don't know, but it was good timing on my part.
Considering I have read we might consume more than 2 pounds of unhealthy lipsticks per lifetime it might have been worth the higher $59 price to be able to use any recipe for lipstick or chapstick I want, when I want it, not to mention any color in the world.
After finding and deciding to purchase this mold a few days later I purchased lipstck tubes, tiny measuring spoons and spatulas, the best butters from across the world (thank you Amazon), oxides and pigments from Amazon.
Because the orders arrived so quickly and wrapped so securely, it didn't give me much time to research lipstick and color recipes to tweak and make my own, so I haven't yet opened my new mold. I continued to search and learn about high gloss, matt's, waterproof and plumping, supple and antiaging recipes and I am now ready to give this a try.
It all looks pretty basic, even cleaning the mold.
Right now I have my favorite (not necessarily healthy) Chapstick in every room, all vehicles, and in my purse for constant dry, hot, freezing, desert weather protection and I can't wait to replace them with my own tints, and colored lipsticks.

All in all, I am quite satisfied with this purchase.

title: Great glass files
text:
These files are fantastic. I really like the fact that they're not etched like any other glass file. They do a great job at filing natural nails without all that ear splitting, teeth hurting, grinding noise other glass files make.

As far as buffing/polishing goes, yes, they do make a naked, natural nail shiny. But unless your nail is free of bumps, humps, divots, etc., it's going to take a long time to shine the nail evenly. What you end up doing is making thin/weak spots in the nail which will cause breaks or cracks as the nail grows out because these files take off a lot of nail. You can get shinier nails quicker with a base coat.

"Jeff's Wife" - I've used the white name brand for years and some store brands but not the charcoal ones. These work just as good as the others, although I'm not sure if the charcoal really makes a difference.

The description photos show slits in the strip but I haven't seen them in mine, not a big deal but they do serve a purpose. I'm very happy with these.

title: Nice set
text:
"Jeff's Wife" - I got these when they were an Add-On Item for $3.99, definitely worth the price. The stamper works great, I didn't even wash it first (even though you should always wash new stampers before first use), and it's slightly (I do mean slightly) softer then other clear stampers I own.

If you're new to stamping or not familiar with clear stampers, they are more delicate than opaque ones and tear easily, so be gentle with it. Wash it with dish soap & warm water, dry with a paper towel and clean it with a lint roller or tape. Never buff it or use acetone, you'll make it cloudy defeating the purpose of a clear stamper. When picking up, ROLL GENTLY over the image if you apply too much pressure it won't pick up. When applying the image to the nail press straight down (again, with GENTLE pressure) and rock side to side or roll from side to side. Don't push the tip of the nail into it, it will tear.

All the plates stamp great, I didn't swatch every image, although plates 29 & 41 have shallow etching (in my experience this is normal for BP plates) so the thinner scraper is a nice addition. It's not as thin as the 0.5mm and not a thick as the 1mm ones I own, I'd say it's 0.75mm (I didn't get out the calipers). There are different size images, a little for every nail size. But I do wish the water marble designs were bigger, I'm not a Water Marble Witch yet. Plate 52 is great for lead lighting or Sharpie water coloring.

The stamping guide works like it's supposed to, I've added a photo to show how it's used just in case it's confusing. I have a set of 4 templates from another brand already, there's not much difference in size or thickness of the metal but the designs are different. The edges aren't finished, like a plate with no backing, but I don't think it would cause anyone to slice their finger open unless you're being extremely careless.

All in all a great set.

title: Good for Nail Art
text:
"Jeff's Wife" - This is not true to color, it dries quite a bit darker, as you can see from the pic, but since I only use it for nail art I don't care but some of you might. I bought the pink back in Feb. 2015, still using it just got tired of the color, and this one seems slightly less opaque but maybe it's because that one is pink on pale skin but a second coat fixes the opacity, (only 1 coat in the pic). It may leave a few specks of the shimmer on your skin when you peel it off but they wipe away effortlessly.

If you're new to nail art and want to use this for that, I do suggest you transfer some to an empty polish bottle (cleaned with acetone or brand new doesn't matter) using a syringe with some sort of tip, an eye dropper or even a straw, this will keep the large bottle from drying out. This 4 oz bottle will last you a very long time, I still have about half the bottle I bought in Feb. 2015, and costs a fraction of the price as those other brands marketed specifically for nail art.

title: Great stamping polishes!
text: "Jeff's Wife"- These are so good! I only wish I had the original versions to compare. I've only heard negative things about the original stamping polishes from BM so I don't own any, I've only used MdU. But when BM reformulated their stamping polishes I gave them a try and I now own all the new collections so I gave these a try too. Boy am I glad I did. These DID NOT DISAPPOINT! I don't own white stamping polish, I use Sinful Colors Snow Me White that has been open for 3 days, it works but it's still not proper stamping polish. The black I use is MdU, the absolute holy grail of stamping polishes. But I have to say that these are beyond good! This black is comparable to MdU black in every way, except the smell. These have just become my favorite! I don't think I will be ordering from anyone else anymore.

title: Well built and compact
text:
Well built and compact. The charger base works well.

So far the 'waterproofness' has endured splashes, but don't dare try to dump it in a tub of water.

The brushes work well and are replaceable. They should be available on Amazon.

The case is a cool and shiny white patent leather.

title: Another great set of images!
text: "Jeff's Wife"-  Great plates and images that stamp beautifully, as always from Cici & Sisi. I do have two issues. One is that four of the six sleeves are cracked in the corners, like it's old, dried out plastic but I guess it's nothing that some packing tape can't fix. I've never had this issue with the other five sets from them. The other issue is the holder feels a bit more foam like instead of the pleather like the previous ones. But those issues have absolutely nothing to do the stamping ability of the images which, in the end, is the most important thing!

title: Love this stuff!
text: This is my first time using plain silk wrap and I love it!  I started using the self adhesive silk tabs to fix cracks and they worked great so I wrapped all my nails but I had to keep buying them. So I upgraded to this. I'm so glad I did. Yes it takes longer to do my nails now but it's so totally worth it. I wrap my nails every week or so and there's still so much of it left! I will not buy anything else, EVER!

title: Like the other sets it's difficult to get a clean ...
text: Ideas are limitless with the buffet sections on the three plates. Like the other sets it's difficult to get a clean scrape on some of the corner images. But I do think it helps if you have a very flexible scraper, which I don't.

title: You either love it or hate it
text: If you like bay rum, then you'll like Florida Water. If you don't like bay rum after a hot shave then something is wrong with you. Turn in your man card immediately.

title: I returned it
text: It was hard to wear and didn't stay tight in my head so I returned it.

title: Love all of the patterns and they fit perfectly!
text: I didn't see any reviews for these headbands and took a chance. I absolutely LOVE each and every pattern that is in this set. Nothing too crazy, but just enough to add a little extra to an outfit. Would highly recommend these.

title: Easy to use, inside & out on my teeth.
text: Cleaning plaque & flossing.

title: Did absolutely NOTHING!!!
text: What a complete waste of money! I was pretty disappointed with this product. It absolutely did nothing for my lashes in terms of lengthening or thickening. I thought I would see some improvement but nothing changed in my lashes at all. That being said, it does seem to condition them pretty well, but not worth the money in my opinion.

title: I Love it!
text: I love this! I have Rosacea and the grape seed extract helps broken capillaries in your face which is great! I wash my face in the morning and apply a little bit to my face which helps my foundation go on really smooth!

title: Great discovery set
text: I discovered this brand through my ipsy bag, and was excited to try a few more best sellers from this brand. I personally love the vitamin c serum and the moisture boost cream. The squalene oil is great to mix with foundations that are a bit too drying without disturbing the coverage level or texture. Overall, great set.

title: More of an oil
text: This is more of an oil than a serum in my opinion. It does absorb immediately and does not smell strong like many vitamin C serums. It smells very light and fresh with the slightest citrus scent to it. Great to use for both day and night. Does not contain a sunscreen, so make sure to use one during the day. Overall, highly recommended.

title: Great clay facial mask
text: I have very sensitive dry skin, So I was worried that this would over dry and irritate my skin. First of all, it smells amazing. It smells very natural, like greenery and botanicals. This mask has ever so slightly some grit to it. It isn't the scrubbiest of exfoliating masks. The clay doesn't over dry your skin. I do not feel like my skin is tight feeling after washing my face. Overall, it feels very luxurious and relaxing. Great weekly skin treat to unwind at home. Highly recommended.

title: Great moisturizing cleansing balm
text: I have used the Farmacy cleansing balm for 3 years and this is the first time I have used another brand. I find this balm very hydrating. It removes waterproof makeup very well, has a very fresh scent and with a bit of water turns into a milky cleanser. It also comes with a scoop for sanitary use. Overall, it is a great cleansing balm at a reasonable price. Highly recommended.

title: Great for minimalists
text: This is great for minimalists or teenagers. Keeps your essentials organized. you can keep makeup brushes and a few cosmetics in it. It also keeps jewelry, hair ties and other small items organized and easy to find. The mirror is removable as well. Very nice size, and can easily be wiped clean when needed. made of a thick plastic, and the holder slots are silicone. The mirror is a glass mirror. Overall, highly recommended.

title: Great nail files
text: These are very good nail files. They work very well, and lasts through multiple uses. I have natural nails, and I I find that the two different grits work well with smoothing edges and removing sharp corners of nails after trimming. I was replacing my old files after every use and the sand was flaking off and getting all over my floors. I did not have any problems with these doing that. Overall, it's a very high quality product and I would highly recommend it, especially for professional use.

title: Great for brightening the skin
text: I use this at night time as a serum before moisturizer. It smells wonderfully first if all. The texture is very thin and lightweight. It sinks into skin quickly. I do recommend wearing sunscreen during the day time as it can make your newer skin photosensitive. Overall, it's a very easy way to apply vitamin C to brighten skin and even skin tone.

title: Super convenient, great for travel.
text: These are perfect for on the go and travel. Don't leak and the pads are nicely saturated. Great to keep in makeup bags or even as a stocking stuffer. I don't use perfume everyday, so these last me a while. Nice way to try out a fragrance before committing to a full sized bottle as well. Highly recommended.

title: Easy hair styling accessory
text: This makes hair styling very easy. Looks professional, and comfortable for all day wear. The band itself is kinda fragile so you have to be careful not to bend it too far apart or it might snap. Overall, it's a good product.

title: Perfect for hand sanitizer
text: I use this to fill with rubbing alcohol to use as hand sanitizer. I clip it to my bag and use the sprayer to disinfect shopping carts as well. Super handy. They sprayer works very well and does not get clogged. Overall, highly recommended. Have filled all of them and given them to family members to utilize as well.

title: Great face masks!
text: These are real Korean face masks from a great brand. I first discovered this brand from a subscription box and am now hooked. The box contains 10 masks and each are individually wrapped. They have a generous amount of serum in each. Great as a weekend treat at home after a bath. Overall, highly recommended!

title: silly but fun
text: This set of scrunchies and sunglasses for a bride and her bridesmaids is silly but fun. The scrunchies are made of a nice satin type fabric. The sunglasses don't actually offer much sun protection, but they are cute.

title: has some sparkle
text: Overall, I like this powder and feel it is a good product. I have pale skin that can look sallow at times.  I like the pink tone to the shade that I got. The powder is easy to apply with the small puff included, but I prefer to use a soft applicator brush. This powder does have a bit of sparkle in it, which I don't always want, but it adds a nice glow for nighttime use.

title: interesting...
text:
I wasn't really sure what dermaplaning involved before I ordered this product. I watched a couple of youtube clips and decided to give it a try. These tools are bladed scrapers that are used to gently scrape away dead skin and tiny hairs to give your face a fresh, clean, healthy look. In the videos I watched, there was a considerable amount of icky skin removed- literally piles of it! My experience has been much less dramatic. A whole face application resulted in just a tiny amount of "dust" to be removed. I applied a bit too much pressure at first and gave myself a little scratch, so do be cautious. These blades are sharp!
I feel that my skin does look brighter and more healthy. Those videos of dermaplaning likely feature models who had been tanning and not washing their faces so the dirt and oil really built up, and skin was ready to peel.
This product removes tiny "peach fuzz" hairs but I also tried it on a small patch of coarser leg hair that I had missed while shaving. It took it off neatly with no irritation.

title: Go multi purpose balm
text: Takes me back to childhood. I basically used this in lieu of a vapor rub. It really clears the sinuses. And the tingle feels great on achy spots.

title: Rubbing alcohol burns eyes
text:
This stuff smells like hand sanitizer. It smells like straight rubbing alcohol and has a strange texture where it balls up when you rub it in. When I got to apply it to my sons face he yells that it hurts his eyes, and I tried it too and it's like rubbing alcohol is just evaporating into your eyes. If you do get this use it on arms and legs, then get a separate one for faces. That's kind of a hassle though so I'd just nix it all together and get a kid one that doesn't burn their eyes.

I was also disappointed that it doesn't go on blue and fade. There's really no way to see where it's applied unless it does that weird crumbly thing, in which case I'm not sure if it's spreading onto the skin or just clumping up.

title: The applicator is hard and makes the mascara feel dried out
text: I have short, stubby lashes so I was excited to try this. I ended up being pretty disappointed. At first, I thought the mascara was dried out because it looked like there was nothing on the brush. I have dark lashes so I couldn't see anything go on color-wise. I rubbed my hand on the brush and there was mascara on there, it just really did not thicken or lengthen at all. The bristles are also molded plastic, so they are scratchy and do not work well at distributing product. It's one of the worst designed mascara brushes I've seen. I thought it was old and dried up that's how bad it was. I will not be using or purchasing this mascara again.

title: Luxurious Body Cream! Pure Ingredients!
text: Prairie Rose Organics Mint Cocoa Velvet Body Cream is just that - thick, rich & creamy. Seeps into my skin to create a moisture barrier and the scent is heavenly! This has a very “true,” pure blend of cocoa and peppermint. This will make a beautiful gift!

title: All Natural Multi-Use Bath Set Works Great!
text: I've already used them all and they work well and feel good on my skin! The set comes with four pieces and a handle. The tools are all made of natural materials: shower bath brush, body massager, dry brush/pumice stone & loofah. The natural boar bristles bath brush is terrific - I can reach everywhere and it feels great on my back. I really jammed the handle on tightly and it didn't come off the brush while I was using it in the shower. Yet, I was able to remove it when I wanted to attach the massager. These can be used with just the attached handle strap, too. The loofah and pumice stone work great on my feet. Good quality, and I love the way they are packaged to make a nice gift box!

title: Very Hydrating & Lightly Abrasive
text: My husband and I have both used these. I like the hydration, the hydroxy acid and the feel of these -- I do not find them too abrasive at all. I find them to have a very mild exfoliation and very mild peeling effect. My husband says that his skin tingles after shaving because they have alcohol (this has very little alcohol because it is listed way at the end of a long list of ingredients). So, I like them much more than he does! These pads are embossed with charcoal powder that draws impurities out of the skin and clarify the pores. My skin feels extremely soothed and hydrated after using these!

title: Large Bars Of Soap! Invigorating Sage!
text:
My favorite soap!

This smells heavenly! I'll get a whiff of sage while reading in my bedroom, even though the bars of soap are in a nearby bathroom. And it is DELIGHTFUL -- like the great outdoors! Invigorating.

I'm using this in the shower as a body scrubber -- it's abrasive, with bits of sage in the soap.

It may seem a bit pricey, but these are large bars of soap.

Love, love, LOVE Pre' De Provence!

title: This caused me to breakout more
text: I LOVE how this product did give me a beautiful natural glow however, the cost of that flow caused my skin personally to break out. The same ingredients in the moisturizer and this spot corrector is what causes me to break out. So unfortunately this was returned.

title: Dried up!!
text: I love this eye glitter but these were all dried up and old! They couldn't be used.

title: Best Hair Ties!!!
text: These are great!!! They have enough stretch to be useable but still tight enough to hold your hair and return to their shape. The colors are so beautiful! They really do leave no lines in your hair!!

title: Hard to work with
text: Gel was very hard to work with and the fiberglass sheets were so thick they wouldn't stay in a curve, they flattened out while curing the gel. Also any gel on the nail side of the fiberglass sheet would not cure right. I don't know if this was because of the thickness of the sheets or what. Bought these to mend a small split over the quick on my nail plate (instead of using acrylic like I usually do) to keep it together until it grew out and it did not work. Won't be using these again.

title: Love! I have terribly short lashes and this definitely ...
text: Love! I have terribly short lashes and this definitely built them up more than my typical layering of 3 mascaras.

title: Super Gentle
text:
My skin is really sensitive.

I also don't generally like all-in-one products. You should see my bathroom cabinets. Trying to consolidate, but I get different rashes in different places, and no one thing works for everything.

This is very gentle and did not make my skin or face or scalp break out or rash up at all. It's not super moisturizing, but it wasn't drying, either. The scent is very light, and the cleanser has a little minty/tingly kick. This would have worked for me in my teens or 20s when I couldn't wait to get out of the shower and on with my life.

title: Good Moisturizer
text:
This is a good moisturizer and plumper for people whose skin is just starting to age. The plumpers are conventional ingredients, but nothing of major concern unless you are allergic.

I did not get lasting results, but my skin is past just starting to age. I wish I'd had something like this at 40.

title: Expensive Machines
text:
The NuDerma wand has done a lot for my aging skin. There are a few creams and sera I swear by -> modern science is pretty cool. It used to be that anything topical just sat on your skin doing nothing (except the one with the french name and gazillion dollar price tag - which, btw, you can get much cheaper in the blue german tin plus seaweed serum). Anyhoo - enter the era of home treatments. Thermal machines are great if you have the money, and for less (but still not cheap) you can get these wands that are practically miraculous.

Used correctly and alongside good skincare practices, they can clear acne, minimize lines, and restore an awful lot of tone and some volume to aging skin. They don't work for everyone, but my skin is thin from prednisone use and it's aging, and the NuDerma wand has been great at firming and plumping over time.

Mine came with the red wands, and I wanted to try the blue on my kid's pizza face. Did I mention that these things zap you?

Yeah, that's important. They zap you. You want to get some numbing cream. Anyway, he's never going to let me do this again, but it's too bad because it cleared his skin beautifully. And fast. And no giant pores from popping stuff. And because they are combination wands, I can use them on my skin.

All for a very affordable amount.

title: Differentiating
text:
Among retinol creams can be a chore. The stuff is what it is, and retinol is good stuff, if you want to turn over your skin cells the way they used to do it for yourself.

This cream has an excellent formula of retinol, moisturizers, and antioxidants. What it also has that many others don't is a pump that keeps air and light from destroying the ingredients. It's 3% retinol, which is pretty strong, so patch test.

Recommend.

title: Very Fine Floss
text: These picks use plastic, but very little compared to other floss picks. The floss itself is also very fine, which makes it great for my tight teeth. East to carry. Easy to use. Wish it had no plastic, but that's why I save these for the road, and just use a water flosser at home.

title: Rash
text: I'm bummed, because this seems to be working (eyelashes are way softer and less brittle), but it gave me a rash on my eyelids. I have lupus, and my skin is really sensitive, so this probably won't happen to you.

title: Great for a beginner like me
text: This one is easy to use and results are great! I have it for a couple of months now. That is when I decided to do my own nails with gel. My sister-in-law recommended this machine because it was similar to the one that she has. It is not used much because I do my nails every 4-3 weeks. Original drills are good for some applications, but I got a set of diamond drills for Russian manicure. Since then, I never had gel peeling off from the bottom (which was a common problem when I did my nails at the salon) because I clean my cuticles with this machine. I remove old gel with this machine as well. I am a very satisfied customer.

title: Really cute necklace
text: Really liked it and it is didn't lose any stones so far.

title: My favorite roller shape
text: I have a lot of facial rollers. The Y shape is my favorite. The gentle suction massage is very relaxing. This one has a nice weight and feels well made. It rolls smoothly and silently. It came in a velvet pouch in a sealed bubble bag. It's competitively priced right now at $13.99 plus an extra 40% off.

title: Smells like salad dressing and feels like petroleum jelly
text: I didn't care much for this sleeping mask. It came in an unsealed box. There's a plastic cover under the lid, but there was a mess of cream all around the rim and threads. Maybe it was used? It smells like lotion and salad dressing. It feels like Vaseline on the skin, which is okay for a sleeping mask. It made me feel like it was  certainly locking in moisture, but the next day, I didn't really notice anything different in my skin. I like sleeping masks but don't expect I would order this again. I definitely find it overpriced ($44) for the packaging, experience, and results - or lack thereof.

title: Good for the price
text: This came with a foil seal in a bag. It's a very sweet scented gel that feels nice on the skin - like a soft layer/barrier, but unlike other overnight masks I've tried, the effects weren't really apparent once you remove this the next morning. It's currently $12.99.

title: Soft & soothed skin
text: I used this later in a day, after derma rollering, and I felt it helped soothe my skin. No lingering irritation or redness from the derma roller. I'm not sure if it was this serum alone or how it worked in conjunction with my other skin care products, but my skin felt velvety soft afterwards. I enjoyed the lavender-scented milky texture of this serum. It came in a sealed box. It's affordably priced at $9.99. I would get this again.

title: Prefer the Hydrating Instant Mask
text: I really like Everyday Beauty's Hydrating Instant Mask so was hopeful for this Night Cream, but I wasn't as impressed. It didn't seem to leave my skin quite as velvety soft or last as many hours, yet the Night Cream is more expensive at $38/1 fl oz. The Mask is $22/1.7 fl oz and can be used overnight as often as needed. I use it as the last step in my skincare routine. This cream came in a box, unsealed and simply smells like a cream.

title: Gentle exfoliator
text: If you love strawberries and/or are seeking a gentle scrub, this is a good choice. The sealed tub also had a plastic cover under the the lid and was boxed. The scrub had a little brown in it like what you might see when fruit starts to rot or in yogurt, but it's dated good until 9/14/2023, so I felt okay using it. The red particles made my husband and I realize we didn't confidently know the color of strawberry seeds, but I think they are. They feel kind of squishy, and the scrub feels more like a creamy moisturizing lotion. It does smell like strawberries and makes skin soft. This is a different scrub that feels gentle. I personally prefer one that feels like it's polishing and cleaning more than moisturizing though. This is currently $12.

title: Okay cleanser
text: The bottle came in a sealed box. It's a light pink gel. The scent is nice but more fruity-rose like you might find in products scented for children. It cleans okay. I don't feel it's worth $16, but I don't think I would buy this one again regardless.

title: Dry rub
text: The tube had a foil seal. There is a pineapple scent. You're supposed to massage the gel on dry skin for 2 minutes. As soon as you start, it starts to pill. I feel like most of it immediately dries up and falls off though I'm sure it's grabbing dead skin too. While it's gentle in that it's not using coarse particles, I didn't enjoy the dry rubbing and tugging at my skin. You can only avoid that over 2 minutes by applying a generous amount of gel, but it's a small tube. My skin looked a little brightened afterwards but not as soft and bright as many other exfoliators (scrubs, peels, masks, serums, etc). This is $12.99, which doesn't seem like as great of a value after seeing how much you need to use. I didn't like the application, results, or price enough to reorder this.

title: Very glittery
text: I have a lot of orange-gold lip colors because I find them very flattering on me, so I was pretty confident I would like this. The color is beautiful and not too orange. While I like the gold too, the specks of glitter are larger and more obvious than I would like. Some gold is really fine and distributes as an even shimmer across your lips. With this, you can see the glitter speck here, the glitter speck there, the glitter speck falling a little outside your lip line that will probably end up somewhere else on your face. It has more of a youthful, party feel. I agree it's a color reminiscent of sunsets, suited for summer and fall. The case is possibly the most sophisticated I own though. It has a nice weight, and the magnetic closure feels good. It came in a box and in a sealed bag. I don't mind wearing this color, but I wouldn't buy it again. I think I like the case the best, but I'm not convinced the color or feel add up to make it worth $38.

title: Maybe better for older skin?
text: I've used a drugstore pressed powder for years and always gotten compliments, so it's hard to think I need to pay $52. I can't say I was especially impressed by this. HOWEVER, I'm getting to the age where I'm starting to notice my makeup can look dry and accentuate lines I didn't even think I had. I'm not wearing much makeup these days, but based on reviews, I got this with the hope it will work for maturing skin. I can see this also washing you out a bit as another reviewer mentioned. It's white, and even though I'm fair, I felt this needed a very light application. The good news is if such a thin dusting can live up to the reviews, it makes the price a little better. I was surprised how low quality the puff felt. It's very thin and almost felt rough.

title: Affordable, average mascara
text: Reviews when I ordered this were raving about it. It's not bad, but it's not all that. Many more reviews have been added since then that reflect that.

title: Working well
text: I needed a brush for my cats because the one I've been using removes almost too much hair and hurts my one cat plus it's uncomfortable to hold. The brushes I've been seeing look flimsy and painful with their wire tips. I liked the rubber tips on this so took the chance. It's working great so far. I can tell it doesn't hurt my cat...although she still doesn't love what's happening. It smoothed their hair without pulling it all out. The bristles kept their shape. The button pushed all the hair up, so I could cleanly and easily pull it all off. It's more comfortable to hold, and the cover is actually helpful to keep the bristles clean and protected from being bent. It's a little large for even my large cats but totally doable. It would definitely work for larger dogs as well. The price is reasonable and considering so many other similar brushes received poor reviews, I'm especially happy with this for the price.

title: Clean, Citrus, Pine
text: I bought this out of curiosity about foam cleansers and because a reviewer said it smells like coconut. Actually, it smells like citrus pine to me, which makes a lot more sense looking at the pinecones on the package and the fact is says there pine leaf, grapefruit, and citron extracts. It's a nice scent if you like those. Anyway, I'm finding one pump of these foams work for me (maybe I would need more if I was wearing makeup, and I wish I could tell you how well this removes makeup). This spread thicker than other foams I have used so far. It felt like it did a good job cleaning and left my skin soft and fresh. The price is on par with other foam cleansers I've tried. This would last me a long time since I only need one pump, but I'm just as happy with cheaper cleansers with scents I prefer.

title: One Star
text: It did not do what it said it would

title: Pretty and Natural looking lashes!
text: My daughter and I tried the lashes out as soon as we got them.  We wore them when we went out and they were beautiful and natural looking lashes.  We love these and I would definitely buy them again.  They came with a nice eyelash tweezer too!

title: Good  toothpaste, a little too strong-flavored for me.
text:
I gave it four stars, just because the flavor is so strong. Apparently I lean toward blandness, because others I've talked to like it as is.
I won't toss it out. I just rinse more after using it.

title: Works great, I love this item.
text: This works so good on face and hands and other dry skin areas. It's easy to use and feels so good. It really hydrates your skin. I use it every week. I will be buying more as gifts for my daughters birthdays.

title: Great little hair dryer
text: I loved that it came with an assortment of attachments.  There are three settings on the hair dryer; fan, low, and high.  Also it has a cool button.  Using it on low there was more than enough heat to dry my long hair in a short time.  The big attraction is that this takes up very little space in my tiny bathroom.

title: Very fresh
text: I bought this to blend my own tea, and I was very impressed with how fresh this was when I opened the package.  I don't know how long this will hold it's freshness.  That will be the determining factor as to whether or not I buy a bag this large again.

title: LIKE VERY MUCH GREAT!!
text: GOOD PRODUCT, EASY TO USE!

title: Great price, great colors polish
text: Great colors and nice metallic shine!  Will rebuy.

title: Five Stars
text: Love this product and the price much better than Mugler site!

title: WOW Amazing stuff!
text:
I was searching for something with Volufiline and found this inexpensive tube. Thought I would take a chance with it being much less expensive than others I found. It was delivered on time and packaged really professional and nice. I couldn't wait to dab some on my eye areas. I went back to the mirror about 30 minutes later and almost every bit of puffiness was gone. So, I dabbed a little more around the area and much to my surprise, my eye area looked like I just had botox! I have used it going on almost 2 days and have already ordered more of their products. Going to see how the Gold Milk Steam Cream 200g does on my mature skin along with the Pancoat Pop Vita gloss+lipstick+tint works out.
These are Asian companies and made.. Just as the Manufacturer describes - "Cheap and works” . It has a nice soft aroma that goes away quickly as it is put on the skin.
I am shocked that there are not any other reviews for this product...
For the price and quality, so far I am super pleased and would recommend this product to others.

title: For me, this is a fantastic product; I'm grateful I found it.
text: My skin has always been, at best, blotchy, and if I try some kind of coverup, i usually break out.  I'm not sure what led me to this, but I picked this brand because it didn't seem to have any ingredients in it that I needed a chemistry degree to evaluate. Good choice. No, great choice. I have been using it for three or four days, and my skin is obviously clearer, almost not blotchy at all!  This is amazing. (Would it work for you? Only one way to find out. Tty it.)

title: Left hair shiny.  Scalp itched.  Hair fell out.
text: Shiny hair is nice - I've used a vinegar rinse for years, didn't need it with this shampoo.  However, my scalp itched incessently, and my hair continued to thin.  I think if I kept on using it, I'd have become tonsured.  I have gone back to the recipes in Grow Hair Fast, have made my own shampoo, used it for two days - and no more itch, and increased confidence I won't go bald.

title: Good product.
text: Gets the job done.

title: Serious staying power COMPLETELY NON-DRYING! Winner!
text: I received a sample of this in my IPSY bag, fell in love, then began the hunt for the right shades. This is the best lip stain/ long wear lippie I've ever used. Great pigmentation, smoking the, feels like nothing when wearing, the only truly non-drying lip stain or extended wear lipstick I've ever used. It really does last all day. If going for full coverage make sure to give it a solid 5 minutes to set. The hardest part is finding just the right shade. I ended up scouring YouTube for swatches.  REALLY love and recommend.

title: GREAT TRAVEL BOTTLES! Tested, used, durable, affordable, GREAT SELLER!
text: Honest, these bottles and jars are great. High quality. I love that a spatula was included for the jars. I wish it was one for each, but really, I love the attention to detail there. I have used these, just got back from a short trip, and they will be going with me to Spain in 2 weeks for holidays. They do what they say they will, easy fill, click dial for the label, squeeze every bit out, no leaks. The zip bag ripped on second use. That was no bother to me,I didn't need it. EXCELLENT seller communication!  After purchase, I received an email to see if I was pleased, wrote back that I was, except for the bag, and described. Seller thanked me for honest input and is looking for a new supplier of more sturdy bags. Kudos to this little shop, I hope they do very well in the big Amazon world. Great customer service. Beyond the quality product, I would go out of my way to do business with this seller again.

title: Seriously, ditch the pouf. You NEED this :)
text:
My new love- Good bye pouf balls. This is amazing, really feels like it is exfoliating, especially now with my dry itchy winter skin. I love this. Kept one, will be giving the other two away with nice shower stuff as gifts, then will order more for myself. I wish I had of found these years ago.

Adding to previous review- I am finally ordering another 3 pack. I gave away 2 of the first 3 pack as stocking stuffers to family. Now everyone in my family is talking about these and wanting them. *Please note, if you have really sensitive skin (like me) these work great, just remember don't scrub as hard as you would with your everyday pouf ball thing. These do the exfoliating job just great without lots of pressure. Also, mine has held up beautifully. I throw it in the wash and air dry, still looks new. I really love how I can use on back. I know it sounds silly to get this lathered up (hahahaha) over a product, but this is a game changer.

title: Pretty scent long lasting!
text:
This is a lovely smelling perfume smells just like Juicy! It lasts a very long time just about as long as juicy does and it does not have an over bearing scent like some perfumes it comes in a good sized bottle that will last me for quite a while! Very happy with this purchase will buy again and will also try other scents form Watermark Beauty!

I was fortunate to receive this product at a discounted price during a special promotion to test in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
The discount has not influenced or impacted my judgement of this product. I take this seriously and include my own opinion and experience with each product I review. I am in no way required by the seller to leave positive remarks about their product. If you have found my product review to be helpful, please thumbs up this review. This will make it easier for others to find this review so they may be helped as well.

title: Best product for skin rashes or dry skin
text: If you, or your child suffer from skin rashes like eczema, psoriasis, or just have dry skin, this is amazing.  My 15 month old grandson has had ongoing issues with eczema since birth and this is the only thing that has really worked.  We use is everyday and it's just amazing how fast the splotches start to fade away.  Love it!

title: Good, but...

title: Like the facial roller
text:
I have to admit that I don't use the bottles with the crystals although they do look nice. I wanted to try the facial roller. I had another facial roller that I liked but it disappeared so I wanted to see if this one was just as calming and cool.

Good news is that the facial roller in the Rose Quartz Massager Facial Roller with Bottles for Essential Oils is cool and calming. I give it a slight edge over my old one because the rose quartz is pretty. I'm not sure if it is anti-aging because I don't really pay attention to that. If it is having an effect, then great, but for me, the rolling action helps me wind down at the end of the day. The motions are soothing and quartz is cool against the skin. It is easy to clean and it keeps well too. With the two roller bottles, it does make a nice gift set. But this is a set that I'm keeping. Hopefully this one doesn't disappear.

title: Smooth application
text:
I like this Makeup Sponge Beauty Makeup Sponge Blender Professional Foundation Sponge. It says "Snowflakes" on the plastic box but I don't know if that is the actual brand name. Given the teardrop design, it probably can be used with a powder based item like eye shadow, but I prefer to use it for foundation blending/application. I like how sponges can use a bit of water with the foundation to help with spreading the foundation on the skin and this sponge does a nice job of this. The foundation goes onto the skin so it looks sheer, fresh and polished. It also does a good job of blending so concealer conceals but doesn't appear obvious. I like that is easy to clean and doesn't have the "make up sponge" smell. If anything makes me stop using a make up sponge, it is the rubber-y used smell that it can get, but this sponge doesn't have that smell so I'm glad of that.

Overall, it is a nice makeup tool to have in the make up box. I like it.

title: Works great
text: I have fine hair and I was concerned that the boar bristle would pull my hair or get entangled in it.  So far I'm loving this brush - one benefit over others is that the tips are coated which helps keep it from getting tangled.  It is a lightweight brush but seems to be very well made.  I've used brushes before (including boar bristles) and I like this one just fine.  I've only had it a couple of weeks so if anything changes, I'll add to this post.  So far, thought, it seems quality and gives me a perfect curl under on my ends!

title: Good Light Perm Solution
text: Had been using this perm for years when the store quit carrying it. Was glad to find it on Amazon. It is not a strong permanent solution so it rarely burns the hair.  I'm sure you could but it really is good for fine hair. It does have a strong perm solution smell that lasted through the first shampoo, but since it is so good with my hair, it is a small price to pay.  It is important to do a test curl if your hair is a bit longer in order to ensure the bottom curls as much as the top. I didn't time it right last time and the bottom of my hair didn't curl as tightly as the top. A test time would have helped. Still, overall it is an excellent perm for thin delicate hair.

title: Great Product!
text: Smells great, feels good. There are no ingredients which are reactive on my sensitive skin. The measured dose and airless pump are super features. Best of all, my muscles are not "twitchy" when I lay down to sleep at night.

The box is so tight it is hard to get the swabs out and to open and closed the box. All of the boxes are in a larger box. We had to tear the larger box to get all the smaller boxes out. Not good for travel in our opinion as the box is flimsy and they are just so difficult to get out especially when the box is full.

title: Perfect fit
text: These replacement heads were a perfect fit for my rechargeable Oral B toothbrush. The bristles are firm, but not hard, so brushing is thorough but not painful. They're also more resilient than the original brush heads which got bent out shape very quickly. By comparison, these hold up quite well. And the price for all 8 heads is quite reasonable.  There's no reason why I'll ever buy any other replacement heads as long as I can get these.

title: Good little shaver
text: One of the trials of growing older is a fuzzy face, so I appreciate the gentle way this shaver attacks that fuzz, whether it's soft and peachy, or stiff where the hair has gone white. No nicks, no burn, no discomfort, just a light buzz, and the hair is gone. Sometimes it takes a couple of passes, but it gets the job done.  And I love the light that lets me see more clearly where the hair is or isn't.  Well worth the money in my opinion. Runs on a single AA battery.

title: Pleasant
text:
A little goes a long way with this foaming cleanser which is probably why you don't get a lot in the bottle. It lathers up nicely, and comes off leaving a slight slickness on my skin like most moisturizing face or body washes. My face felt good after I used it, clean but not tight or dry.

It is awfully pricey for what you get, so I can't tell you to rush right out and get yourself a bottle. I couldn't afford to use it all the time. I note that it comes with instructions on how to reuse the bottle, thereby cutting down on waste. Unfortunately it came wrapped in several layers of paper in a special box, so... Not quite as small a footprint as they're saying.

Nice enough, but not a necessity.

title: Great for the whole body
text:
Yes, I do love this product. Not so much for my face because it's probably the most emollient moisturizer I've ever used, and I don't like the feel of anything heavy on my face, particularly during the summer when the humidity is high. But on the rest of my skin? This feels like heaven. As I've gotten older my skin has gone from mixed to quite dry, and this facial moisturizer just ends the flaking and itching, just stops it dead.

I can't say if there's an anti-aging effect going on here since the only place my age shows on my skin is on my face, but if the way my skin feels after applying it is any indication, I'm getting younger by the day. It's a generous 3.4 oz of cream for your money, and you don't need to apply a lot to get the bene fit. So if you have dry skin anywhere on your body, I would say don't hesitate to try this stuff. You may just be happier inside your skin than you have been in a long time.

title: Mystery substance helps quite a bit.
text: I have no idea what this stuff is or how it works, but it helps my mouth when it's irritated or when I have a sore in it. I had a canker sore (which I tend to get when I'm sick or stressed) and it healed it up before it grew larger as it usually does. I burnt my tongue on hot tea last week and swished this around my mouth mixed with water a few times, and my tongue was fine the next day. It doesn't heal you up right away, but it seems to make you heal faster. It burns and tingles too, so if you hate that feeling I'd avoid it.

title: Best hairdye ever
text:
Hands down best hair dye ever, and I've tried a bunch of brands. It lasts the longest and has the most vibrant colors.
It smells like cherries and has the consistency of something like cold cream.
For best results I bleach my hair to at least a medium blonde, although it is best practice to bleach as light as you can go. Don't even try it with black hair, it won't show at all.
I wash my hair once a week and the vividness last at least a month if using sulfate-free shampoo and cold water. Thereafter the color starts to fade into a lighter and less saturated tone, but still pretty. Since my hair is damaged by the bleach, the dye stains my hair and it settles to it's final color in about 4 months.
The dye helps smooth out my hair considerably after a damaging bleaching session.
I only wish they had more colors and jared versions since getting it out of the bottle is a pain when you reach the bottom. This stuff also stains your furniture and bedding (dark colors moreso than others)
Attached are photos of my hair freshly dyed shocking blue, and after a few months.
Other pictures include the dyes atomic pink, blue velvet, and fishbowl freshly dyed and after a few months.

title: For Facial Use Only!
text:
First off, you shouldn't be shaving anything but your face with this razor. Norelco's older models seem to be heavier and have more powerful motors; this thing is more like those old electric lawnmowers that couldn't cut grass more than 1/2" high. It gives a middling shave on face and neck, but it certainly can't handle the forest around the Great Oak Tree, if you know what I mean. It also won't do armpits or backs or legs very well.

I'd go with an older model that is heavier and seems to have a more powerful motor. You'll need it to clearcut your axillary forest.

title: Perfect for tight space on marble subway tile in bathroom (not in shower)
text: I did not purchase this on Amazon, but purchased at a local store because I wanted to physically view it first.  I have a bathroom with a sink under a large window.  There is a small space between the sink and windowsill that is tiled in polished marble subway tile (with almost no grout lines).  This is my children's bathroom and I wanted to give them a mirror to help them with brushing their teeth.  I needed something small that did not require nailing or gluing and that would not break and hurt my children if it fell off.  This item pretty much perfectly fit the bill.  My one worry was that it would not actually stick to the slightly uneven marble tile surface.  I was also a little worried that the image would be warped and ultimately unhelpful.  I have had this now for about a year and it has held up beautifully.  It fits in the space perfectly, has a nice modern and clean look that blends into the slightly grey tone of my marble tile and most importantly, stuck without any problems (make sure to stick to clean DRY surface), even with small fingers poking at it.  NOTE that I cannot really comment on the other reviewers' comments about fogging.  It has never fogged up for us, but our placement doesn't really lend to anything fogging to begin with.

title: This is nice oil. Works very well as a beard oil.
text:
I have a big fluffy beard. Unfortunately in the winter, it more resembles a brillo pad in texture and I sometimes look like a homeless person.

This oil works well to condition and treat your beard, and the skin underneath. I apply it right out of the shower after towel drying my beard while it is still damp. I use three squirts of oil, placed in my palm, run my hands together and massage into my beard. It keeps my beard soft and supple all day, and treats the skin underneath to stop dryness and itching.

I almost thought of trimming my magnificent beard down because it was so rough, and it was itchy, this is allowing me to continue to grow it.

My beard hair is soft, manageable, and free of knots.

The glass bottle is heavy duty, so you can take it when you travel.

My ONLY complaint is the cost. It's pretty expensive, but I think a bottle would last you 2 months or so, but it's still a pretty hefty price to pay for a soft and manageable beard, free of itchiness.

title: Great hair cutter, easy to use.
text:
My wife is a professional hair stylist. She cuts my hair every 2-3 weeks and relies heavily on using electric shears to do so. This unit works very well. It can work plugged in, or with battery, which should give you about 40 minutes of time per charge.

The shears are sharp and do a great job of cutting through my thick hair. The attachments are also very nice. Unlike other units that have 6 or 7 different guards depending on what you want to do. It has a fixed length one, a short variable one, and a long variable one. For my hair she used the short variable one. The settings go from 1/16 of a inch up to about 3/4 inch, and the long variable one goes up from there.

Having the variable length guards is great as it reduces the number of guards you need and allows you to change lengths on the fly.

Using the shears without the guard is also good for trimming to the skinline, edging and shaping.

The only complaint my wife had is that she wishes it were a little more powerful on battery, but wasn't really lacking in power, it is just that she usually uses professional shears. This unit is actually as powerful or more powerful than most shears you buy at walmart or the like.

Overall a great shear for home hair cutting.

title: A great way to trim your beard!
text:
This is a great way to trim your beard. A definite step up from traditional trimmers. The magic in it is the vacuum that captures and stores trimmed beard and mustache hair instead of letting it fall into your sink to make a mess. You don't make your lady mad, and everyone is happy.

The trimmer itself fits comfortably in your hand. It has an detachable cord that allows the unit to be charged. It can operate on the cord or off it's batteries for cordless use. The trimmer is NOT submersible.

The attached guard can be adjusted to 9 length settings with a rotating selector. It can also be taken off for trimming necklines or other areas. There is also a separate smaller attachment that can be used for precision cuts.

The vacuum is power and made more powerful over earlier models through the use of the "Turbo" button that amps up the cutting power and vacuum power substantially. When you are done cutting your hairs are captured in a removable tray for disposal. There are still a few hairs that don't get sucked up but it a huge improvement over using trimmers without suction.

The only negatives are that the hair capture cup is a tad small. There is also a plastic piece that guides hair into the cup that makes neck and cheek-line trimming a little tricky until you get the hang of it.

Overall a great trimmer for those of us real men with beards. A must have!!

title: Great For Making Eyes Sparkle

This makes it hard to apply the adhesive evenly and to achieve a strong hold.  With practice this becomes less of a problem.  The scissors are nice, not spectacular and not very sharp; but a nice addition.  All in all a good buy and great for us makeup artists or rather those of us who would like to be.

Time will tell as to the effectiveness it has on scars and stretch marks since it it still early in my testing, so I plan to return to update my review later and will include before and after photos as well.

title: The BEST for preventive maintenance &repair of your skin
text:
Quickly approaching (a still, sadly, rather vain) age 40, I have personally spent a small fortune over the years trying to slow the aging process and reverse the effects of too many days spent gardening without sunscreen. I cannot even begin to list all the products I've somewhat foolishly gambled on to get my skin looking better. This product--and several other products offered through the company NEOTERIC (all under the Alpha Hydrox brand)--are exactly the answer I've been looking for. I've used them both alone and in conjunction with a more expensive brand of anti-aging products (for which I've also left good reviews on this site), and I can see great improvements both ways.

I decided to try this brand of alpha hydroxy cream after reading in Dr. Oz's (and Dr. Roizen's) book [[ASIN:0743292561 You: Staying Young: The Owner's Manual for Extending Your Warranty (You)]]. I'd tried several other alpha hydroxy products before this one (i.e. ROC, etc.) and must say this particular line (ALPHA HYDROX) is far superior to any other I've used. That it is also apparently considerably less expensive than most is icing on the cake, in my book.

Regarding this product, I find the key is to use it AT LEAST once a day, and always after using a mild cleanser. At my age I still get acne and, despite my sometimes manic picking, I notice it (and any residual puffiness or redness, and resulting scarring) clears up much, much more quickly than it used to. Also, my skin breaks out much less than before I used this. The tone and color of my skin are far improved when compared to prior to using this product. I've run out of it before and tried to use something else until I was able to locate more locally, and to my dismay the condition of my skin began to deteriorate.

I won't try to insult anyone by saying the Alpha Hydrox line will remove every wrinkle or fix all your skincare woes. If there is a product out there that does this, I want to know! But for now, this is by far the best line of products I've used. I use this item, particularly, with the line of skincare I reviewed previously, as that seems to address reversing the signs of aging better (where this one, for me, just improves the overall condition and appearance of my skin).

title: A bit small

She hates brushing her hair but does like using this one. I think the build quality could be a little better but it's acceptable and it does a good job. The bright color also helps to find it in her messy room.

title: Likeable liquid lipstick
text:
To me the shade on the product picture looks like it might have a little pink in it but I don't notice it when I apply it. Maybe that's just me 🤔 Regardless, I feel the shade is very pretty...and definitely is metallic.

It's also very long-lasting- to the point that later when taking it off, I used both an oil cleanser and makeup remover. Transferring is minimal. It actually stays a little sticky the whole time while wearing it, so that makes it a little surprising that it's so long lasting- since many liquids dry completely. It's not overly sticky, so I didn't find it bothersome.

Applies smoothly- it does feel like a velvety, whipped texture

If you're concerned about the appearance of lines on your lips with a liquid lipstick- I feel this is one makes them a bit pronounced.

Overall, for a liquid lipstick, I think it's pretty good. Has rich pigment and has a stand-out metallic look

Packaging is pretty

So getting the opportunity to try it out allowed me to branch out and try a shade I would normally be hesitant to buy. I'm glad because I love it! I ended-up loving the shade and how it looks on me. title: Liking it

Having health stuff going on, former daily tanning machine user, former smoker and my weight goes up-and-down- all things that have contributed to my skin changes and my neck is no exception. This cream is soothing and leaves a lot of moisturize but not a lot of goop. I feel like my skin looks smoother, though I'm sure more consistent and long-term use will bring the most benefits and results. The texture of it is so creamy and thick and feels great on! Arrived sealed and packaged-up really well.

title: Good Quality Hair

I ended up dying mine black because I naturally have very dark hair and I was tired of maintaining the lighter color with bleaching and all that jazz. These actually were very easy to dye and look great! I didn't glue mine in I ended up using some clip-in extension pieces and making a ponytail extension out of it. It looks great and the hair is really excellent quality.

If you are using them as glue in extensions you will definitely need at LEAST 4 sets of these to get a decent amount of hair throughout your head. It's just not enough otherwise.

title: Kissable Lips!
text: This is a must-have especially during the winter when the wind hits your lips and they become dry and chapped. It gets all the dry flaky dead skin off of your lips leaving them super soft and supple. Not the mention the product itself smells and tastes great. 10/10!

title: Fresh & Clean
text: I don't know what it is about goat milk soap/cleansers, but they are so luxurious! This is no exception. I have a pre-teen daughter who is on the cusp of puberty and has been suffering from a little acne. She has extremely sensitive skin so this face wash was the perfect option for her. It has kept her face clear from blemishes without drying out her skin.

title: I see some results
text: I'm not even going to lie to ya'll... I wear my mascara thick with multiple layers. This makes it SO hard for me to get off. It's not unusual for me to accidentally pull out my eyelashes trying to get my mascara off. This has left my eyelashes looking very sad. I decided to give this a go and I think I see results. My problem is I am defeating the purpose by wearing too much mascara! I think I just need to invest in some fake lashes.

title: Excellent for Dry Skin
text:
If you are an ashy kind of gal then you need some body in your life!

I'm always up for trying something new so I was excited to try this ULTRA LIGHT FULL SPECTRUM BODY OIL.

I think it works best if you put it on while your skin is still damp right out of the bath or a shower. I also try to exfoliate a little bit especially on my legs and other problem areas like elbows and knees.

It's lightly scented which I like because if it's too overpowering it can really flare up my allergies.

I wouldn't use something like this on my face because I do tend to be on the oily side. But for the body it really works great!

title: Elevate for Facials!
text:
I love having this Rose Quartz Roller Face Massager for applying all types of face masks and treatments to the face.

When I put a facemask on I like to roll this over it. The rose quartz feels cool and it just feels so refreshing on the face and neck. It's also easy to clean which is nice. I also apply some lotions / creams with it. I like to apply my hyaluronic acid with this. It seems like it works better than using my fingers alone.

What has really impressed me though is the Microneedle Derma Roller. I only use it a few times a week but I really feel like it has helped with my dry flaky skin around my t-zone which has always been a problem for me. My face has never looked better!!

title: Junky

I'm sure my girls will be able to use them on their dolls. Such a shame. The organizer box though is nice! I'm sure I'll be able to use it for something else.

title: Salon Perfect Nails!
text:
I just wan't ya'll to know.. I have never given myself a gel polish manicure in my LIFE before yesterday. I had been wanting to for the longest time, but I wasn't 100% prepared to make the commitment to purchasing the light and the top coats and the bottom coats and the paint, etc, etc..

Well if you are on the fence, jump it!

First of all, the lamp works. You set your timer and once you do that, all you have to do is put your hand it and it starts automatically. Awesome! Like a real salon. I was able to do my hands in 45 minutes. It would have been even faster but I did a test run on my thumb before doing them all at once to make sure I didn't mess anything up.

Overall, I am SO happy to have this nail curing lamp!

title: Been using it for more than a year!
